posts.post_content:
@ saucyninja007  
  
Suprisingly bad? do you understand what this card does? you don't use this to dig through your library you use it to perfect your hand and to get to choose what to draw over the next two turns, giving you a free card in hand to replace itself - excellent card advantage, also allowing for the desired triggering of [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets), or any miracle, which can usually result in complete victory. Just because you don't know how to run a card does not make it "bad" by any means, it just reflects your skills as a player.
posts.html:

Posted By: Demonic_Professor (12/27/2012 1:46:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card has quietly become one of the absolute best in the history of Magic.  
  
It was strong library manipulation before combo. It was strong library manipulation and a combo deck enabler before it worked like BUTTER with the sac-lands, it was strong library manipulation, a combo deck enabler AND worked like butter with sac-lands before it synergized with Countertop. It was library manipulation, a combo deck enabler, worked like butter with sac lands AND synergized with Countertop BEFORE IT BECAME A NEARLY BROKEN BEAST-MACHINE WITH MIRACLE.  
  
Now, to be honest, it might have passed counterspell as the most staple blue card in the history of the game. And is clearly already the most played.  
  
All for a little Ice Age common. Amazing.
posts.html:

Posted By: EGarrett01 (2/7/2013 3:47:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The card that was meant to scale down the power level of [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall), an instant speed card selection engine is still incredibly powerful. 5/5 for sheer insanity. I agree with everyone that if Brainstorm were reprinted in Standard it would be game warping. Blue would be insane with [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets), [Snapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snapcaster Mage), [Dimir Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Dimir Charm), [Simic Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Charm), [Azorius Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Charm ) , and [Izzet Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Charm).  
  
Its probably a good thing that Brainstorm isn't in standard. Also great art.
